Package address

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
address.Menu
public class Menu extends Object
Menu class prompts user for input for various Contact field parameters, e.g. name, address, etc.
Since:
v0
Author:
Arshdeep Padda

  • Method Details

    • prompt

      public static String prompt​(String query)
      Prompt user a query via stdio and return response. Note: query is printed without implicit newline.
      Parameters:
      query - - Query to prompt user.
      Returns:
      String - User response.
      Since:
      v0

    • promptInteger

      public static Integer promptInteger​(String query)
      Prompt user for a integer given some prompt query. If input is not an integer, user is notifed as such and asked repetitively for valid input.
      Parameters:
      query - Prompt to print.
      Returns:
      Integer provided by user.

      private static void printMenuChoices()
      printMenuChoices - Print menu choices. This is a purely print-only function.
      Since:

    • displayMenu

      public static String displayMenu()
      Display Menu and return user choice. User choice is validated between [a,f].
      Returns:
      User choice.
      Since:
      v0.5

    • load

      public static void load()
      Prompt user for filename and call init on ab.
      Since:
      v0.6

    • add

      public static void add()
      Prompt user for contact addition and call add on ab. All fields of contact are requested from user.
      Since:
      v0.6

    • remove

      public static void remove()
      Prompt user for search of user to remove, show contact results of search, and perform deletion based on user contact selection.
      Since:
      v0.6

    • find

      public static void find()
      Prompt user for search query of last name to search contact store, then display all contacts with last names starting with query as prefix.
      Since:
      v0.6

    • list

      public static void list()
      List all contacts.
      Since:
      v0.6

    • exit

      public static void exit()
      Report exit and exit with code zero. Peaceful exit processes, e.g. saving, can be implemented here.
      Since:
      v0.6
